newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said on Thursday.

"Government securities were narrowly mixed again on lack of fresh incentives. Treasury bill yields were slightly lower but bond prices were steady to slightly higher. The interbank rate was unchanged and volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.13/2.08 percent compared with Wednesday's yield of 2.22/2.17 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.37/2.32 percent against 2.42/2.37 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 was unchanged from Wednesday's close of S$98.03/98.08, September 2001 ended at S$97.15/97.20 versus S$97.13/97.18 and June 2003 was unchanged at Wednesday's $95.15/95.20.
The overnight interbank offered rate was unchanged from Wednesday's 3-5/8 3-1/2 percent.
